boardgame.name: Timber Timmy
boardgame.description:
Each player gets a hammer (hammer head is hollow) with which he has to collect colored plastic hats in the correct order as quickly as possible. The order of the five colors is determined by a revealed card. The first player to collect 5 cards wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Robin Hood
boardgame.description:
Robin Hood is an old school style tactical solitaire board game of action and adventure, with a bit of wargame and RPG elements mixed in. An open-ended sandbox style game where the player may choose his own path.

Set in Nottingham Shire, England in the year 1180, the player will control up to 6 Merry Men at once. The Merry Men will frequently encounter enemy bandits, Nottingham soldiers, or possibly even Foresters in Sherwood Forest.

Game components include a Nottingham Shire map, various mats, a tables book, and several counter sheets representing individual Merry Men, soldiers, weapons, items, etc.

The player moves his band of Merry Men across map, searching for rich targets to steal from, visiting Newstead Abbey and The Blue Boar Inn to buy necessary items, gamble, or pick up new quests. They may even sneak into a castle in order to steal gold or rescue a peasant in the dungeon.

As the Merry Men earn more experience points, they will continue to improve their skills.

The ultimate goal of your Merry Men is to arm the towns of Nottingham Shire, convince them to rebel and attack Nottingham Castle, and remove the Sheriff from power before December 31st, 1180. To accomplish this, the Merry Men must increase Loyalty of the town to 10, plus arm the town with 10 weapons. The more towns that take part in the rebellion, the better chance they will have of succeeding in defeating Nottingham Castle and removing the Sheriff from power. But if the towns fail to remove the Sheriff before December 31st, the Merry Men will all be automatically hunted down and executed.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood

boardgame.name: Norrköping, Linköping (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
boardgame.description:
Fan expansion to Ticket to Ride, set out in the Swedish towns of Norrköping and Linköping. A two sided board has been professionally printed, along with ticket cards. A base game of Ticket to Ride is needed to play the maps!

The maps are much like the USA/Europe maps, but there are some special rules. In Norrköping there are tram tracks and a bonus for North-South/West-East and in Linköping players compete to build at the runway at the airport.

The maps work well with 2-5 players. Stations (TTR Europe) are not intended to be used, but 1-3 stations can be used at the players' own leisure, along with other expansions and add-ons.

boardgame.name: The Consultants
boardgame.description:
The Game:
A fun strategy game in which players choose to play one out of 4 different consultants. Each consultant carries their own ability that players can build their strategy on. In the game, players manage their actions at the expense of working hours of which each player only has a limited amount for each round. Thus, resource management will be a key factor to win the game. Working hours can be used for lobbying politicians, getting an intern to receive additional working hours, receiving effect cards, or acquiring courses and projects which will educate your character and provide you with additional income.
While the game is round based, players can also take an active role, even if it is not their turn, by playing effect cards or participate in auctions for either projects or courses.

Custom Game:
The base game can be played in three different versions. Which allow players to opt between an asymmetrical and symmetrical gameplay or change the numbers of components in the game to adjust the difficulty of play.

Story of the game:
While the game mechanics require a strategic mindset, the actual theme of the game is a satire about the consulting industry. Effects like “Auditor” who is displayed as a blind person and approves important documents with his stamp, should remind players how shady the industry can be (Auditing firms caused the financial crisis in 2008 because they assigned ratings without evaluating them properly).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Thunderscape Archetypes: Entomancers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even among the varied cultures of the Known Lands, the Entomancers are an oddity. Able to summon, speak with and command hordes of insects both great and small, they possess a form of magic that makes others distinctlly uncomfortable. The nation of Kyan is maintained by their power, and the legendary Insect Riders are respected throughout the world of Aden for their power and martial prowess, not to mention the gigantic hornets on which they ride into battle!

This third installment in the Thunderscape Archetypes series brings the most iconic roles from the World of Aden to Savage Worlds: Adventurer Edition! All the material that was printed for Entomancers in our original Savage Thunderscape core book for Explorer Edition has been revised and updated for Adventure Edition, and we've added so much more! New Edges of every type, new weapons, new armor, new magic items, and more, all packaged together with enough background on the Entomancers to play them in whatever campaign world you want, or to bring the World of Aden to life at your table!

boardgame.name: ダブルナイン (Double Nine)
boardgame.description:
A Love Letter type game where you are trying to build the highest double digit number by the end of the round.

Each player draws a card then plays it in one of two piles. The first pile is the tens, the second pile is the ones. At the end of the game, the player with the highest number wins. 99 is the max since the cards are numbered 0-9.

However, the number cards from 0 to 9 have various effects such as "one-time break", "card replacement", and "hand exchange" . By making good use of these card effects, players aim to get closer to the strongest number, Double Nine (99).

The second edition includes 20 expansion cards not available in the first edition.
—user summary
boardgame.boardgameartist: Yuri Takahashi (タカハシ ユリ)

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the ThunderZine, the support 'zine for all of Kyoudai Games brands, including the Infinity's Edge Role-Playing Game, the Tiny Legacies line of sourcebooks for Tiny Supers, and Thunderscape in all its many forms!

The ThunderZine is developed for and with the members of the Kyoudai Games Patreon, who get it several months in advance of the public and who have the opportunity to contribute ideas and requests for specific content.

In this inagural issue:

An excerpt from the Savage Archetypes: Arbiters PDF for Savage Thunderscape!
The Dauntless, a unique airship and the flagship of the Arastinian navy, presented with background and mechanics for Thunderscape TinyD6!
The Tiny Legacies Index of Teams, listing the many different teams and major players in the Legacy Universe of superheroes and villains!
A preview of Streets of Fury, the forthcoming Tiny Legacies sourcebook about street-level heroes and the history of New York in the Legacy Universe!
A Player's Guide to Dungeons for Infinity's Edge, explaining the size and scope of the different rarity of dungeons, a companion piece to the forthcoming 100 Quests!
20 Loot Drops for Infinity's Edge, a companion piece to the forthcoming 100 Loot Drops!

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the ThunderZine, the support 'zine for all of Kyoudai Games brands, including the Infinity's Edge Role-Playing Game, the Tiny Legacies line of sourcebooks for Tiny Supers, and Thunderscape in all its many forms!

The ThunderZine is developed for and with the members of the Kyoudai Games Patreon, who get it several months in advance of the public and who have the opportunity to contribute ideas and requests for specific content.

In this second issue:

A continuation of the Legacy Index for Tiny Legacies, completing the entries on teams!
The first installment of Random Heroes, bringing new heroes and villains to Tiny Legacies. In this installment, the archvillain Nocturne, the Shadow of the South!
A selection of Crafting Schematics for the Infinity's Edge role-playing game!
The optional skill tree system for Infinity's Edge characters!
In the Lair of Arcus, an adventure for Thunderscape TinyD6!

boardgame.name: Warlock! Rogues' Gallery
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a supplement for Warlock!, the old-school roleplaying game inspired by the early days of British tabletop gaming.

Miscreants, vagabonds and ne’er-do-wells!

Every town has them – rogues, scoundrels and blackguards. Best avoided most would say. But sometimes, it is these folk who really know what is going on, and can sell you that information. For a price of course.

Rogues’ Gallery is a collection of over twenty five characters that can populate any city of the Kingdom, or any fantasy realm for that matter. The entries are system neutral, and advice is given on how to adapt the characters to your game, and how to create detailed character maps to give your adventures depth and realism.

boardgame.name: The Big Book of Characters Volume 11
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Grab a set of percentile dice (d100) to give a random character or you can find a character at the correct level for your adventure.
...
Oftentimes we find ourselves sitting around the table, with a set adventure path before our players, and the inevitable happens. One player is unprepared for the session or is in need of a new character.

No problem.

boardgame.name: Shinkansen: Zero Kei
boardgame.description:
The Tōkaidō line of the Shinkansen began being built in 1959 with the aim of inaugurating the fastest train of the time, just before the 1964 Tokyo Olympics.

In Shinkansen: Zero Kei, players take on the role of its builders. They will take charge of constructing this historic railway line and all its corresponding stations. They can also help the Olympic venues in their preparation for the Games. The player who proves themselves to be the most efficient in their role will be declared the winner.

In each round of a game of Shinkansen, you will build your own bullet train, each carriage card you add to your train will provide you with an action or an ability. These actions will mainly allow you to build tracks and stations, collaborate in the preparation of the Olympic venues and obtain new carriage cards. The carriage cards are associated with cities through which the line passes. If you manage to build them in the correct order you will be rewarded in victory points. After five rounds, corresponding to the five-year construction of the line, the player with the most victory points wins.

•••

La línea Tōkaidō del shinkansen comenzó a construirse en 1959 con el objetivo de que el tren más veloz del momento estuviese listo para los Juegos Olímpicos de Tokio en 1964.

En Shinkansen Zero Key, los jugadores, en el papel de constructores, se encargarán de edificar esta histórica línea férrea, así como las estaciones que la forman. Además, podrán contribuir a que las sedes olímpicas estén listas para los Juegos. El jugador que desempeñe su tarea con mayor eficacia se proclamará vencedor.

En cada ronda de una partida a Shinkansen,irás formando tu propio tren bala, cada carta de vagón que añadas a tu tren te proporcionará una acción o una habilidad. Estas acciones te permitirán principalmente, construir vías y estaciones, colaborar en la preparación de las sedes olímpicas y obtener nuevas cartas de vagón Las cartas de vagón, están asociadas a ciudades por las que pasa la línea, si consigues construirlas en el orden correcto obtendrás una recompensa en puntos de victoria. Tras 5 rondas, que corresponden a los 5 años que duró la construcción de la línea. El jugador que haya obtenido más puntos de victoria se proclamará vencedor.

boardgame.name: Portsmouth's Problem
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Today we bring out the Xobraesal Campaign. Started just before the pandemic, the series is short but quite entertaining. Today, you start in the main city of Arcpool as first level PCs looking for a job!

Although set in the Xobraesal Campaign for six players, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

boardgame.name: Stworze: Odrodzenie (Revised Edition)
boardgame.description:
Stworze: Odrodzenie is an adventure/tactical board game that takes you on a journey to the world of Slavic mythology inhabited by Stworza – magical creatures that live in the world of people and participate in their everyday lives. Stworza can be merciful, but must not be disregarded! They are also prone to punish people with their anger. In Stworze game, the players take on the role of one of ten Stworza and carry out various missions to increase their influence on the Realm.

The Stworze that will first conduct all missions from its Mission Deck will be victorious. Each mission requires the performance of actions, while each action requires the performance of specific activities on the board. These activities are meant to increase the influence of the given Stworze on the Realm and, consequently, to make the player its sole Caretaker.

When performing an action, the players can decide whether to help or harm the people. They can also carry out a mission or send the people to raid the dens of other Stworza. Moreover, the choice of a particular action brings all Stworza closer to the activation of an Event – such as Forfather’s Eve or Koliada.

Stworze: Odrodzenie is a second, revised edition of the game. There is a separate expansion to convert first edition.

boardgame.name: Extra FAKTY
boardgame.description:
In Extra FAKTY, players take on the role of journalists working for an tabloid with dubious reputation.

There are two game modes during which players will outdo each other in building the most interesting headlines. Each title will consist of three elements, and it depends on the creativity and ingenuity of the participants whether the subject of the article turns out to be a sensational mishap, indecent behavior or a love intrigue.

In the competitive mode, players will compete in providing the best articles for their newspapers, while breaking the ranks of competitors.
In the cooperation mode, the players' task will be to jointly provide a pool of taken topics that will allow to close one issue of the newspaper

boardgame.name: Around the World in 80 Days [1994]
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Learn about geography in this educational game loosely based on Around the World in 80 Days where you follow Phineas Fogg and his sidekick monkey Sidney travels through 11 countries on five continents and interact with culture, landmarks and also learn foreign phrases.

boardgame.name: Reign in Hell: Demonic Skirmish Combat
boardgame.description:
Reign in Hell: Demonic Skirmish Combat is a fast, brutal, miniatures-agnostic tabletop wargaming ruleset that pits your hand-picked cabal of demons against your opponent’s to determine who gets to reshape the ruins of Hell to fit their Philosophy.

Do you want to restore Hell to its former glory?
Tear it all down and watch it burn?
Or perhaps try to head back to Earth for some payback?
You can customize your cabal, use whatever demonic miniatures you’d like, and tell the stories of your battles through the in-depth campaign system.
We’ll see you in Hell.

Reign in Hell is designed as a fun, quick skirmish game that allows you to play using the demon models you may already have from many different fantasy games out there, or build (or 3D print) new ones to make your cabal exactly the way you envision.
The campaign system is robust, and allows for growth and customization for your demons as they gain Titles and discover Relics and Essences to increase their powers.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Reign in Hell: The Oculus Spear – solo and co-op expansion

boardgame.name: Paint the Town Red: Vengeance Will Be Yours
boardgame.description:
A scenario, based on a classic Clint Eastwood Western.

The mining town of Lagos a remote mountain place in Inyo County. The local townsfolk fear the return of three notorious outlaws who they helped send to prison years ago, and when a mysterious gunfighter rides into town unannounced, the citizens of Lagos beg him for help. But the gunfighter, known only as “the Stranger” is not here by coincidence. He has a mission of his own....

To play this scenario, you’ll need 13 cowboy miniatures and a small Western town. There are a dozen characters in this game, each with a custom character card. Assign each player in your game the role of an Outlaw or a Citizen. There is also a card for the Stranger, but he will appear randomly throughout the story and may be controlled by either side.

Before the game, each player will be asked to revisit a decision from earlier in the film, providing an opportunity for you to write a new ending to the movie!

—description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Ruthless: The fastest rules in the West

boardgame.name: Arnie Goes 4 Gold
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Promotional game for the Bank Austria about Arnie who is looking for a key to get the heritage from his rich, dead uncle Fritz.

boardgame.name: The Monkey King: The Legend Begins
boardgame.description:
Cloud Master is a horizontal scrolling shooter released for the arcade by Taito in 1988.[1] Home versions were released for the Sega Master System, PC Engine, and Famicom, with all save the Master System version released only in Japan. The PC Engine version of the game is titled Gokuraku! Chuuka Taisen (極楽!中華大仙). The Famicom version is titled Chuuka Taisen.

In 2008, Starfish SD, a company founded by former Hot-B employees, bought the rights from Taito and developed a remake for the Nintendo Wii. It was released under the title The Monkey King: The Legend Begins, dubbed Shin Chuuka Taisen: Michael to Meimei no Bouken in Japan.[1]

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cloud_Master Cloud Master]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: So, You've Been Eaten.: Language Pack
boardgame.description: German Language Pack

boardgame.name: Game of the Year: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
Game of the Year is a thematic board game about making video games. It can be played solo, competitively or cooperatively.

In each session, players takes on the role of a video game publisher and release up to three titles. Players win if they are awarded Game of the Year. If they fail to be awarded Game of the Year (or run out of money prematurely) they lose.

A title is created in three phases. In the pitch phase, players combine a genre card with 1-2 themes and 2-3 features drafted from a shared pool. In the development phase, players choose from separate pools of dice employees to generate resources. These resources are used to complete the title's themes and features. In the release phase, the title is compared with a rival in order to determine its success.

Players must skilfully use resources to create stars and avoid bugs in order to succeed in the competitive video game marketplace. The rewards for doing so include money (used to play dice employees), tech tokens (used to remove bugs), reward cards (which grant players unique abilities), and additional hype (which must be maintained otherwise the company is forced to close).

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wormsign: The Dune Quickstart
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

"They say you can't drill in the desert – storms and sandtides destroy equipment faster than it can be installed, if the worms don't get you first."

The Dune: Adventures in the Imperium roleplaying game takes you into a far future beyond anything you have imagined, where fear is the mind killer so be sure to keep your wits about you. The Imperium is a place of deadly duels, feudal politics, and mysterious abilities, noble Houses politic constantly for power, influence, and vengeance in a universe where a blade can change the fortunes of millions.

Sent out to investigate beyond the shield wall for your House, you know deadly dangers await you on the sands of Arrakis. Can you locate the smugglers stealing your House's spice? Or will you run afoul of the mysterious and territorial Fremen who live out in the deep desert? Out here you only have yourselves to rely on, and there is no power greater than the vast worms who jealously guard the spice.

Whatever you do, remember that those that control the spice control the universe.

Wormsign, the Dune: Adventures in the Imperium quickstart:


Introduces you to the byzantine world of the Imperium, putting you in the heart of events set to change the universe.



Offers you the basic rules you need to play, including both physical and social forms of conflict.



A complete adventure designed specially to introduce the rules and the incredible science-fiction setting of Frank Herbert's Dune.



6 elite agents as pre-generated characters to let you get playing as quickly as possible.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Dune: Guía de Inicio. Señales de Gusano

boardgame.name: Finders Creeperz
boardgame.description:
"Finders Creeperz" is a uniquely clever and challenging game that requires a combination of strategy, luck and killer instinct. A plethora of different gameplay scenarios will unfold giving a different outcome every time and fun for all of the family. The aim of the game is to trick and capture your opponents with the help of your CREEPER, action cards and traps (pre-game traps and on board traps) leaving you in the clear to get around the board and take the win. It's high paced from start to finish and you can be called in to action on anyone's turn. Just because your go is done, you are most certainly not safe. The attack/question cards are hectic and full of twists. Those who you think are your friends often turn out to be enemies and you are all but guaranteed to have to choose between one friend or another. We take no responsibility for any arguments that follow. Do you trap your kid or let your partner win? Will you put yourself in a trap just to send your best friend back to the start? OF COURSE YOU WILL! Be ruthless. Be bold.

Yes, we know that the vast majority of games claim to be equally as fun for parents as it is for kids but this one actually is... Trust me, as a parent there is little I enjoy more than the look on a kid's face go from joy and smugness when they think they are going to win, to despair and anger when they slowly realise they most certainly are not. It's like a fun punishment. "Funishment," if you will... After all, they'd most certainly do it to you! Life isn't fair and they will soon realise this.

boardgame.name: Death Fungeon
boardgame.description: Steam description - A puzzle platform game, with both stealth and parkour elements. Use your wits, cunning and agility to escape this deadly prison. Take the stealthy approach, progressing slowly, hiding and staying out of sight. Or utilise your athleticism to wall jump, ledge grab and speed run your way to freedom.

boardgame.name: Deep, In the Forest
boardgame.description: Steam description - Game is a deck building roguelite card game with RPG elements. Save the forest kingdom from the oppression of the Mad King. The game is developed by a small team of two people - fans of the genre. We want to create our own unique game and we hope you like it!

boardgame.name: Depixtion
boardgame.description: Steam description - Welcome to Depixtion, a relaxing puzzle game where you create beautiful works of art using logic. Depixtion blends color mixing mechanics with the rules of nonograms to create a uniquely colorful experience.

boardgame.name: Kingdom Wars: The Plague
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





The sequel to Kingdom Wars: Medieval.User Summary

boardgame.name: The Battle of the Denmark Strait: Fire at Sea – A WWII Naval Combat Game
boardgame.description:
The Battle of the Denmark Strait is played for as many turns as it takes one side to win.

Each turn is divided into the following four phases:

Movement Phase: British first then German.
Shooting Phase: German shoots first then British. However shooting are considered to be simultaneous.
Damage Control Phase: damage ships attempt to repair.
Morale Phase: Ships that sustained hits on the current turn check morale. Broken morale ships try to recover.


Once the Morale Phase is completed, return to the Movement Phase and begin a new turn.

boardgame.name: The Haunted Hamlet & Other Hexes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Haunted Hamlet and other hexes details four unique modular locations for your game.
Made for old school essentials, but can easily be used with other old-school systems or even 5E.

The four locations detailed in the zine focus on gameable content and being easy to use at the table. The locations are not connected to one another and can be sprinkled onto your campaign map however you like, or run as one shots. The PDF is graphic and art heavy and utilizes random tables and other tools to make it easier for GMs to run in a pinch.

Four hex locations
Random tables
A rival NPC party
A sky merchant
A one page town
Two hirelings

boardgame.name: Ngelalangka: The Road of Hoofless Horses
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A market town built on the back of living puppets.

THREE DAYS, IN CLOSE FOREST

Crashing through the brush, a man carries thrice his weight in stacked cargo — “Excuse!” he snorts, waving you aside — he overtakes you.

There is no way to cross the mountains, except through Ngelalangka. On market days every species of trader may be found, here.

What do you need? Magic wines that bestow enlightenment? Hats that shield you from more than the sun? A slave of an ancient and royal lineage, to parade in front of your friends?

Be welcome to Ngelalangka. Bribe the warden, watch your coin-bag, and don’t forget to tip your porter!

Ngelalangka is an adventure setting inspired by Southeast Asian bazaars, Kuda Lumping puppets, and the ways in which rapid development twists local communities. A rules-less, 44-page gazetteer filled with characters, goods, and conflicts set in a busy marketplace. Random generators for merchants and animate animal-shaped puppets. A keyed map pullout.

boardgame.name: Der Schatz der Templer
Le Trésor des Templiers
boardgame.description:
900 ans après la création de l'ordre en 1129, un carnet retrouvé en Ecosse, dans le Midlothian, rédigé par l'un des derniers chevaliers, met les joueurs sur la piste du trésor des Templiers.

900 years after the creation of the order in 1129, a notebook found in Scotland, in the Midlothian, written by one of the last knights, puts the players on the trail of the Templar treasure.

The players have to solve puzzles to find the treasure of the Knights Templar.

boardgame.name: Hundred Red Scales: The Goddess, Bleeding
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An archipelago of silent lizards and lurid textiles.

THREE DAYS, ISLAND-HOPPING EASTWARDS

Laundry lines stretch out past the mangrove trees. They flap like sails over the water: skeins of yarn, sheets of cloth, dyed this morning.

In these islands, spoken language marks you as a foreigner. The monitor-folk do not speak, and did not make words.

Merchants who travel here negotiate with sign and gesture. They come to buy textiles of exquisite craft. Nowhere else are the arts of weaving and dyeing more finely practiced.

With these arts the monitor-folk honour Hundred Red Scale, goddess of beauty — who was murdered long ago; whose body forms the archipelago; whose blood now stains every scarf and shroud the monitor-folk now make.

Hundred Red Scales is an adventure setting inspired by Southeast Asian fabrics, Hindu-Buddhist monastic schools, and the mangrove islands of Langkawi. A rules-less, 44-page gazetteer filled with characters, mud-flat fauna, and textile motifs. Random village generators. Random tables to generate living cloth infused with divine life-force.

boardgame.name: Riding Shotgun: A Ruthless 5 Act Campaign
boardgame.description:
This mini-campaign is structured in five “acts,” or quick scenarios playable in a single evening.

There is a map-based component to this game, representing a cat-and-mouse chase between the Cowboys and the Earp posse.

The Cowboy mission is to escape Cochise County for the relative safety of either the New Mexico Territory or Sonora, Mexico. The Earp player will attempt to track the bandits and bring them to justice before they can flee their jurisdiction!

Divide the players into two teams:
One is given the Cowboy Briefing and the other receives the Earp Briefing. Each team should read and record their decisions before reading or playing each new scenario. Players should refrain from studying individual scenario details beforehand (this preserves some surprises!)

At the end of each act, any characters that were killed are permanently removed from the campaign.

—description from the scenario

boardgame.description:
User Summary

Haunted House is a chase game. One player plays a detective that tries to find all the clue cards. The other player plays a ghost trying to catch the detective.

boardgame.name: Submarine
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Submarine is a shooting game for 2 players or more.

boardgame.name: Anyotas
boardgame.description:
Anyotas is a game based on the Congolese myth of the brotherhood of the leopard men. To which are grafted other mythical characters from the African pantheon such as Mami Wata, the Marabout, Anansi, Ibeji, the Witch Doctor, among others.

The game pits two teams: the Originels against Anyotas.
The latter are hiding among the inhabitants of one of the African cities. At nightfall, they work together to attack a poor Originel. Then when the day comes, they pretend to be just an innocent Originel.

The goal of the game is simple:

For the Anyotas eliminate all Originels during the night phases. When the Originels become outnumbered, the Anyotas win the game.
For the Originels, unmask all Anyota before you are outnumbered. Thanks to their spirit of deduction but also with the help of Originels with powers such as the Marabout, the Hyena Trainer, Mami Wata etc ...


So can you survive the onslaught of the fierce Anyotas?

– Translated description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Country: Democratic Republic of the Congo

boardgame.name: Roulette
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Roulette is a betting game for 2 players or more.

boardgame.name: States
boardgame.description:
User Summary

States is a video game with a map of the states of USA and questions (on fifty trivia cards) about the states, for 2 players or more.

boardgame.name: No Vacancies
boardgame.description:
No Vacancies is a roll and write game where you take on the role of a Caravan Park owner. Four parks compete against each other to build the most infastructure, have the best attractions, book the most sites and attract the most customers.

This is achieved by rolling six dice three times and making the best combinations you can. As your park fills up allocating all dice becomes harder and unused dice means areas must be eliminated. Bonus cards can come in two ways. Firstly by completing a section of the park such as powered sites, unpowered sites, pool side sites, cabins, infastructure or attractions. Secondly by matching all the sites listed on customer card.

When your board is complete or all the customers are taken the game comes to an end. Add up all acquired sites and bonus cards to determine the winner.

No Vacancies combines the chance of the roll, with the risk of pushing your luck for bigger and better rewards. Strategy comes in the choices between completing sections, chasing customers or going for the big attractions.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Fighter Command 2.0
boardgame.description:
Fighter Command 2.0 is a game component module for use with Minden's Battle over Britain game series.
The module contains all 271 rated airplane counters (plus Dogfight Display and game system Reference Card) for all current games in the system.
Planes from Britain, Germany, USA, Japan, Italy, France, Russia, Belgium, Netherlands, Poland, Australia, AVG China, and Finland are included, including all the famous early war planes and many lesser known ones.

No rules or scenarios are included in this module; you must have a copy of the core rules to use this module.

What's included in Fighter Command 2.0:

One counter sheet (32 warplanes) from Battle over Britain, 2nd. ed.
Four counter sheets (119) from Tally Ho!
One counter sheet (20) from Battle over Europe
One counter sheet (32) from Battle over Dunkirk
One small counter sheet (8) from Solitaire BoB Supplement
and as a bonus, one counter sheet (32 bombers) from Bomber Command module, and three small sheets (28) from Battle over Britain Extra Game Set
plus a Dogfight Display and game system Reference Card.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Battle Over Britain: Tactical Air Combat Game, RAF vs Luftwaffe, 1940 (Second Edition)
Tally Ho! Tactical Air Combat Game, Allies vs Axis 1939-1942

boardgame.name: Rise of the Tomb Raider - Endurance Mode
boardgame.description:
Alone and in the wild, Lara must scrounge, scavenge, craft and survive the harsh elements by day, as well as lethal threats from enemies, both man and beast, by night. This is her ultimate woman-versus-wild test to push the limits of how long she can survive on her own in sprawling, unforgiving landscapes. Fire takes fuel, cold kills the unprepared, food restores health, but everything must be caught, collected, or crafted. You start with nothing and must find everything. Challenge friends to your longest survival run and battle to the top of the leaderboards for the title of Ultimate Survivor.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Loup Garou pour une Nuit: Epic Battle
One Night Ultimate Werewolf: Epic Battle
boardgame.description:
This best-of contains a selection of the most exciting roles from “Werwolfe Vollmondnacht”, “Werwolfe Morgengrauen” and “Werwölfe Vampirdämmerung”.

Who dares the epic battle between werewolves, vampires and villagers?

boardgame.name: World Class Rugby
boardgame.description:
Back of case
WORLD CLASS RUGBY combines superb graphics and realistic animation with gameplay so true to life you'll be on the edge of your seat cheering'! All the key aspects of Rugby Union are included - tackles, scrums, mauls, rucks, line-outs, penalties, conversatsions, offside - even rugby's highly sophisticated advantage rule is implemented.

Choose from the many preset moves as you plan your winning strategy. With one eye on the radar you can see what's happening anywhere on the pitch - or, if you prefer, switc to the innovative 'blimp' view for a smaller scale display which increases the visible playing area by four times!*

All the countries from the 1991 Rugby World Cup are represented, and you can play freiendly matches or a complete World Cup competitiion. TO see a more realistic game you'd probably have to go to Twickenham!

WORLD CLASS RUGBY - no other game looks like it, or plays like it! Reviewers agree - "Without doubt the definitive rugby game" (The One);
"Should do for rugby what Kick Off did for football!" (Amiga Computing).


Amiga and ST - other versions may vary

boardgame.name: World Class Rugby '95
boardgame.description:
User Summary

1995 edition of World Class Rugby

boardgame.name: The Adventures of Down Under Dan
boardgame.description:
Back of box

Full 'Talkie" Adventure game with Photo Realistic Settings and Digitalized Video Animations

Welcome to The Adventures of Down Under Dan - an interactive point-and-click graphic adventure game with full "talkie" sound, including music, and speech - thousands of lines of recorded speech, in fact. Spread over four gruelling virtual days, you must battle extreme conditions and solve complex puzzles in the quest to strike it rich and ensure your future as a bush pilot. The game uses video digitised animation over photographic background for convincingly realistic settings. You'll be amazed at the predicaments that you manage to yourself into - and hopefully, out of!

boardgame.name: Cut Throats Tavern
boardgame.description:
Cut Throats Tavern is the second adventure in the Zadorf series of mini solitaire card games, but can also be played as a stand-alone game.

Gamble, cheat, and risk your life in a variety of games as you try to raise the stake money required to enter into a game of Duel against Big G – the proprietor of Cut Throats Tavern.

All games are card based and you must work out the best strategy to increase your 3 Zeds (the currency around here) to 10 Zeds.

Gamble on the outcome of fights, try and outfox Roxy, and risk it all in a game of Russian Roulette against Mad Jack.

If you raise the 10 Zeds required you can then enter into a game of Duel against Big G. Win and you will gain weapons to aid you in your final adventure against the evil Lord Zadorf at a later date, lose and you will forever be in Big G’s debt!

Be careful how you tread, it’s not called Cut Throats Tavern for no reason!

—description from the publisher

Fun Zoo is a game where players gonna react fast and move to the right animal in a zoo.

boardgame.name: Sołtys

As your future son-in-law Leon run awat from the wedding your task as head of the village Wąchock to bring him back.

boardgame.name: Adventure Tactics: Side Quest Guide Book 2 – Beyond the Tower

User Summary

Promotional game for Findus's fish stick of the Croustibat line featuring the mascot under the same name.

boardgame.name: Arkham Archives: the Lovecraftian Gamebook Series
boardgame.description:
Four interactive adventures set in the world of the Cthulhu Mythos. Walk through the steps of Ace, the main character, as he faces Lovecraftian entities in different times and places, only to find himself on the verge of a catastrophe as old as Earth itself.

The game is played on four separate book, each telling the story of a new character, with different mechanics and goals. The common point lies in the card deck, which appears in the story as a key element too.

The project and the cards are a limited edition Kickstarter exclusive.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
User Summary

Volleyball is a sports game.

boardgame.name: J.B.
Mutation of J.B.
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Johnny Burger plans to visit his cousin Emanuel for two weeks, but he is nowhere to be seen once J.B. arrives. He is offered 500 German Mark to participate in an experiment, but it turns out going wrong and Johnny is turned into a human pig, and Johnny finds out that the professor is kidnapped to the planet Ladea.

Now Johnny have to find the professor so he can turn normal and find Emanuel.

boardgame.name: Soccer
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Soccer is a sports game. This game was not released in US.

boardgame.name: Kopf & Würfel
boardgame.description:
Players move around the track to the center of the board by forming the longest words possible.

To start the game, the first player rolls the die from the Start circle and moves to their first circle. They must then roll again and all players must try to form a word in that category, using the first letter indicated by the dice roll according to the table printed on the game board. The player with the longest word wins and moves his piece the same number of spaces as the letters in the word.

The first person to the center of the board wins.

boardgame.name: Massel
boardgame.description:
Each player receives 20 tiles, which he wants to get rid of as quickly as possible by rolling 2 dice.

You can get rid of a token by a matching roll in a not yet filled number compartment. If the number you roll matches a compartment that is already full, you must take all the tokens out instead.

The player who gets rid of all his tokens first is the winner.

boardgame.name: Folklore: The Affliction – Farmer Bundle
boardgame.description:
My travels have taken me to the black corners of this land. I have seen wonders and terrors alike. I have huddled for warmth in alley and cave, drank of waters both foul and holy. I’ve lost every book I’ve read, every coin I’ve clutched, and every hand I’ve held. But here I sit, by my own hearth, on my own farm, surrounded by friends. Many a long night await you out there in the wilds. May the bread we break tonight carry you through, at least for a time. When you are lost, or cold, or lonely, remember this fire we shared. I am so thankful you’ve stuck by me, comrade. Please, stay awhile and listen...

Features):

Update your first edition copy with everything new!
Includes the revised second edition rulebook, updated errata cards and other content
The Equipment Pack brings new life to previously text-only items and companions
Contains new Vita/Power Point/Creature dial trackers
Create your own stories and characters with the Adventure Creation Kit
Experience six brutal stories in the Nightmare Tales book


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Wolves of St Augustine: A scenario for Modern & Tales of Horror
boardgame.description:
Lieutenant Daniel Dulle and his squad from the 95th have been tasked with blowing up the bridge at Villa Verde to cover the retreating flank of the army.
Normally this would be a job for the Royal Engineers, but a group of French dragoons are in hot pursuit.

This is a scenario for Fistful of Lead: Horse & Musket

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Popcorn!
boardgame.description:
A fast and competitive card game in which players try to get a set or run of cards before the other players, while also trying not to get caught hogging too many kernels if someone else beats them to a set.

Each player is dealt a hand of five cards, and then once the dealer says go, players discard down to no less than three of their cards and takes up to two cards from the middle bowl. Players may also trade cards between each other until someone has a run or set of cards. Either 5 cards in sequential order, or 5 cards of the same kernels, or 5 cards of sequential kernels. Once the qualifications have been met the player to do so yells "Popcorn!" at which point all other players cease discarding.

Players then see which cards they have in hand that do not belong in their hand, and the Popcorn! player gets the sum of kernels on the combined cards. Cards are shuffled and redealt by the next dealer, and play continues until everyone has dealt, whoever has the most kernels is the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Gedonia
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Open-world RPG inspired by the classic RPGs of old.User Summary

boardgame.name: Pharaon: Conflits
boardgame.description:
This first expansion for Pharaon adds conflicts to the already busy life of the children of the Pharaoh, and solving them can prove quite expensive, but also very rewarding.

Conflict tiles will be placed on several spots of the Wheel of Actions, substantially increasing the Action Cost for the corresponding areas. Paying this costs will gain the player Sword tokens, giving them access to the new Bonus Actions from the different areas.

This expansion also comes with new Nobles, Artisans and alternative Pharaoh tokens to enrich the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: SKYE
boardgame.description:
SKYE is a flight game that focuses on exploration in a world inspired by the Scottish Hebrides. Fly around the islands, completing quests for villages and racing trough the world in your seaplane. Fly around in a painterly environment.

Non photo-realistic rendering.

exploration at your own pace.

Source: The Developer Website.

User note: Free on Steam

boardgame.name: Backyard Baseball
boardgame.description:
Backyard Baseball captures the spirit of an impromptu game played by two teams of two kids each. The game lasts three innings. Each half-inning consists of a series of plays, each of which has four steps:

1. The fielding player positions the fielder pawn, then secretly chooses a pitch card.
2. The batter chooses a batting card, both players reveal their cards, and roll the die.
3. Compare the roll to the # on the pitcher's card; if it's less, check the pitcher's card to see where the ball goes, otherwise use the batter's card. If the fielder pawn is there, it's an out, otherwise it's a hit!
4. The batter may try to extend the play and advance the runner(s), but the pitcher gets to play a card to try to throw the lead runner out.

The batting team only has two pawn, so when a pawn that's on base has to bat, it's replaced with a ghost runner.

If a runner reaches home, the batting team scores a point (run).

After three outs, the teams switch roles and repeat the process.

The team with the higher score after three innings wins!

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: La Juguetería
boardgame.description:
Each player receives a "wish list" card that they will keep in secret. In every round four “toy” cards will be revealed and all players can try to buy them using whatever money they have available. When several players want to buy the same toy, they must fight in a dice competition to decide who gets it (winning dice result appears in each card). Those players who don't buy anything in a round will win a coin.

The first player to complete their wish list wins the game.

There are 4 ways to play plus a solo rules as well.

Includes an expansion for the game "La Caza de la Calabaza" called La Caza de la Calabaza: Strawberry-Go-Round.

—description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameintegration: La Caza de la Calabaza: Edición Integral
La Caza de la Calabaza: Edición Integral

boardgame.name: Time Paradox
boardgame.description:
Back of box

Having been sent back to the times of Cavemen and Dinosairs, Kingsoms and Knights, Time Paradox challenges you to find your way back not just to the present day but to fure as well!

Encounter helpful Friends, meet devious Foes, mix potions of magic, and even experience the supernatural in you quest to ride the time machine which controls your date-

This is the game for FRP fanatics who think they can outwit the smartest of Design teams and successfully omplete a cunning and vlevery thought of Adventure in Time.

boardgame.name: Temple of the Slumbering Orchid
boardgame.description:
"For generations, a tight-knit niche of mouse botanists have been studying regarding this mysterious plant, the only one of its species. Though information recovered from ancient ruins reveals that it blooms only every 100 years; the importance of this plant, or why creatures of the past built a temple around it, remain mysteries. However, these mysteries might soon be solved. If the old manuscripts are accurate, the Slumbering Orchid is about to bloom again."

Dive into a strange dungeon full of strange flower traps and twisted plant monsters.

This two-spread module includes:

- Isometric and top-down maps of the dungeon
- Four unique monsters
- Four unique items

Although this dungeon was created for Mausritter as a submission for the Mayfield jam, it requires a minimal amount of effort to be adapted for other systems.

boardgame.name: Arcadia (Issue 4 - May 2021)
boardgame.description:
Arcadia
Issue 4
May 2021
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Swimming Through Sand to Sea: More Mounted Adventuring

boardgame.name: საფეხბურთო მენეჯერი (Football Manager)
boardgame.description:
საფეხბურთო მენეჯერი (Football Manager) is designed for 2-4 people.

Travel the world of football, follow the rules of FIFA, meet rebellious fans, famous football agent will help you buy the players you want, negotiate with your rivals and make transfers.
Manage your budget, buy famous players and compete with your rivals according to the number of stars they own.

Goal of the game: collect one or more teams (10 football teams), develop them by buying a coach, a federation, earn income, bankrupt your rivals and WIN !

boardgame.name: Fire Emblem Heroes Book 1, BLADE
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Many years ago, the royal families of the Embla and Askr Kingdoms worked together to open and close gates to various worlds. Then, one day, Embla refused to close the gates of the Askr Kingdom and invaded other worlds. Askr went to war against Embla to protect the other worlds. This war waged until the Emblian king died, and his second wife ended his warlike policies. So well-liked was the King of Embla that many people committed suicide upon his death, and the empress wasn’t as well-liked. Then the Emblian King’s daughter, Veronica, restarted the war when she took the throne.

boardgame.name: ბიზნესმენი (Businessman)
boardgame.description:
ბიზნესმენი (Businessman) allows players to take the first steps in business and prepare for the many challenges in life.

The goal of the game is to buy more shares than all other players, bankrupt opponents, and accumulate the most capital.

boardgame.name: Grouch Couch
boardgame.description:
Ever wonder what happens to those little items that go missing in the couch? Now’s your chance to find out.

Take turns feeding Grouch Couch all kinds of tasty treats. Then press the remote-control and see what happens. He might grumble, chomp, burp and (hopefully) eat your treats! When he does, he’ll spit out Lost Goodies (coins). You’ll want to collect these because the player with the most Lost Goodies, wins.

Players roll the dice to see how many treats to feed the couch and also to see if they can take goodies that can take from another player.

boardgame.name: IQ Files: Amnesia
boardgame.description:
IQ FILES is a ESCAPE ROOM card game with 3 independent adventures. Characters meet in a locked room and have to find the exit by resolving several kind of tests: logical, deduction, jigsaw. But be careful!! They can die while they are trying to find the way out!!

There are more than 90 cards in each adventure. Each card has a combination number which you can use to combine any two cards (objects, characters) and see what happen..

Each adventure has a difficulty level from 1 to 10. Although you can play alone, it's easier to play with more people to help each other.

Each game takes from 90 to 120 minutes and there are 2 ways of playing.

Play with chronometer: game ends when time runs up (90 minutes).
Play with no chronometer: to better enjoy the adventure.

Adventure 1: LIBERACIÓN Difficulty 4/10

Adventure 2: PECADOS Difficulty 6/10

Adventure 3: AMNESIA Difficulty 8/10

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Legends of Gold
boardgame.description:
In Legends of Gold players are seeking the wealth of a forgotten civilization in an the ancient temple. You and your fellow treasure hunters compete for the most treasure, entering from different corners of the large hexagonal map.

To be victorious, you must make it out of the map with health remaining and the most victory points found on artifact, treasure and item cards. With a limited hand size, you'll need to balance Treasure and Artifacts with the item cards you'll need to get out alive. Navigate through the twisted corridors of the 65 hexagonal map tiles to get to the center where the most treasure lies. Each tile will either present a hazard or a trap sprung by an event card drafted by a player on their turn.

After choosing an event card, players will have one free action per turn, choose to either gather treasure or item cards, heal or move through the map revealing new tiles. On every cave-in event the lowest numbered tile is removed from the map. To hasten your escape, you may wish to trade a health for a second action. If you're not fast enough to be the first one out, you'll find yourself racing to find an exit as the map begins to disintegrate at an accelerated rate.

You may be close to making it out, but managing your health to prevent your elimination may slow you down as you stare down at a pit hazard with no rope item card, but then again, how far are the other treasure hunters? Are there any dangers in the upcoming event cards? Is there a week tile about to cave in on your path? Can you take the loss of health by entering the tile? Do you draw Item cards looking for a rope?

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Dead Media
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Dead Media is the third sourcebook for In Dark Alleys, the game of psychological and cosmological horror. The book details eight obsolete media items, each with dangerous supernatural properties, and the scars they have left on this world. Each is a danger to any person who encounters them, but tracing these items back to their origins will bring players one step closer to understanding the secrets of In Dark Alleys.

Warning: Contains mature subject matter.

boardgame.name: Nuke Trick
boardgame.description:
Nuke Trick is a trick taking card game with a few twists. As the commander of a World War III superpower you need to use all the weapons at your disposal in this all-out-war to control rare earth minerals, oil and strategic industries.

Players start with a hand of cards. Each round/trick is a battle over a few battleground cards placed in the middle of the table. The winner of the trick gets first pick on what battleground to conquer which is then placed face-up in front of that player. Then the 2nd best player in the trick gets to conquer a card etc.

Besides classical trick-taking strategies one must consider what continent the battleground card belongs to (set collection), what actions are triggered when you conquer the card (e.g. change current trump), if you can complete a nuke (which functions as “super trump”), if there are industries, oil, rare earth minerals or support to research space or drone warfare (worth dominance points) and if there is a strong resistance (negative points). The card you play in the current trick will be a new battleground card for the upcoming trick which must also be factored in when choosing what card to play.

The player with the most dominance points at the end of the game is the winner.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Scofflaws (ORC Edition)
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Scofflaws is an action comedy game about near-future gig workers with brain implants that make them smarter, faster and stronger for each unique crime they're committing simultaneously. In this dysfunctional future, to make ends meet you'll have to take on the toughest gigs on various job apps, and you'll only be able to complete them by committing a whole lot of crimes. Think My Name is Earl meets Scott Pilgrim meets Brazil meets Adventures in Babysitting.

boardgame.name: Scofflaws (Fate Accelerated Edition)
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Scofflaws is an action comedy game about near-future gig workers with brain implants that make them smarter, faster and stronger for each unique crime they're committing simultaneously. In this dysfunctional future, to make ends meet you'll have to take on the toughest gigs on various job apps, and you'll only be able to complete them by committing a whole lot of crimes. Think My Name is Earl meets Scott Pilgrim meets Brazil meets Adventures in Babysitting.

boardgame.name: Erê: O Jogo dos Orixás
boardgame.description:
Erê: The Game of the Orixás is a card game about elements of the Yoruba religion found in Brazil today. Cards show different Orixás (deities), some with special effects, others with points for scoring.
In each round, players draft five cards. Then they take turns playing one card each in front of them, using the effects when there is one, otherwise collecting sets. There are some open and some hidden objective cards, and the players will try to fulfill as many of these as possible.
The player with most points after three rounds wins the game.

boardgame.name: Rani: Can you Save the Queen of Punjab?
boardgame.description:
The story takes place in the backdrop of British Raj in India. Rani, the Queen of Punjab was on her way to Amritsar along when she was attacked by a group of feisty rebels. Her Royal Guard defended her valiantly and safely brought her to an abandoned warehouse. Unfortunately, that warehouse was in an area under the British control and they were already looking for an excuse to pursue Rani.

The game is a battle between the two players. One player has to rescue Rani and her guards; the other player is the British soldiers trying to capture Rani.

If Rani can make it outside the warehouse to the truck with the keys, she wins! If the British capture Rani and kill her guards, they win.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Balkans 1944
boardgame.description:
In the late Summer of 1944, the Soviets were poised to invade the Balkans after having inflicted a crushing blow to the Wehrmacht at Belarus. On August 20, 1944, after a period of relative calm in that front, the Soviets opened up their offensive between the Black Sea and the Carpathians. Despite of German counterattacks and setbacks such as Debrecen, by Christmas Eve the Red Army was besieging Budapest, had joined hands with the Yugoslav Partisans, and had occupied Bulgaria and Romania.

"Balkans 1944" is a wargame simulation of the Soviet offensive across the Balkans of the late summer and fall of 1944. The Soviet-Yugoslav player must conquer as much territory as possible within a limited time frame, while the German-Hungarian-Croatian forces must try to delay the Soviet advance as much as possible.

Each game turn represents 10 days. Each hexagon is 30 miles (50 kilometers) from side to opposite side. Units are corps, divisions, brigades or equivalents and some specialized smaller units.

World at War #81 December 2021

boardgame.name: Wetlands
boardgame.description:
The year is 2495 and humans have been forced to live in underwater cities after a nuclear test triggered a catastrophic change in Earth’s weather patterns. Humans have begun to populate the stars, but cities on Earth are overrun with crime, gangs, and terrorists.

The Valarans, a terrorist group fighting an intergalactic war against The Federation, have liberated scientist Phillip Nahj from maximum security prison Alpha 16. The Federation has hired you, John Cole, to track down Nahj and bring him in alive.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Joker Joker Joker
boardgame.description:
Based of the game show of the same name, Joker Joker Joker is a card based quiz game for the whole family to enjoy.

Each turn three category cards are flipped to mimic the game show's giant slot machine. These cards show jokers or numbers corresponding to question categories. Depending on how many times a category shows up in the slot cards, a question of that category's value increases from 50 to 100 to 200 (or 100 to 200 to 500 for jokers). Correct answers award points, but wrong answers give the next player a shot at the points. During a question round when a player reaches $500 they get to play the final prize round to end the show.

In the prize round the three slots are filled with a prize card from three decks of prize cards of varying values, and players can push their luck to turn over the slots one by one. Prizes accumulate for the player and cards reset as they push their luck until they reveal a devil card, choose to stop, or reach $1000 which gives them the big bonus of $5000.

The goal of the game is to have the most money after each player has had a turn as the master of ceremonies and at least one turn as a contestant.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mio: Brädspelet
boardgame.description:
Mio is a co-op game where the players takes the role of a friend of Mio from the book Mio My Son by Astrid Lindgren to help Mio defeat Knight Kato. All the players uses the same pawn, and that is a pawn of Mio. The game has a board with 9 locations, including start and last location (Kato's castle) on it, and paths between those locations with 2-9 steps to walk. On top of the board is also places for 5 courage and 5 stonehearts.

The game play has four phases:
1. Mio moves.

2. The player does actions.
a) travel.
b) regain health or courage.
c) pick up / change various protections.

3. You check if something bad or good happens (some steps on the paths are black, while most of them are white).

4. A cleaning phase where also Kato gradually gets stronger and stronger.

The game ends either when the players manage to take Mio to Kato's castle and defeat him, or when Mio loses all his courage and it has been replaced by Kato's stonehearts.

boardgame.name: Disney's Sport Goofy Tiddly Wink Tournament of Games
boardgame.description:
A "Tiddly Wink Tournament of Games", Disney's Sport Goofy Games features six different sports to play with friends and family. Included sports are soccer, basketball, baseball, golf, shuffleboard, and tennis.

In soccer, players drop 5 tiddly winks of their color randomly on their half of the field and take turns trying to use their Goofy figure base to shoot all 5 winks into their opponent's goal first.

In basketball, players try to shoot all 5 winks in the basket first in a h-o-r-s-e style game shooting a wink from each of the marked areas around the court.

In baseball, players take turns flipping winks across the diamond from home plate trying to land in hits and runs while not causing any fouls or outs. The player with the highest number wins.

In Golf, players take turns flipping winks from the tee towards a number of golf holes on a golf course printed sheet. The player with the lowest number wins.

In Shuffleboard, players take turns flipping their winks towards the scoring pyramid trying to rack up points without hitting the minus 10 zone. the player with the highest number wins.

Finally in tennis, players take turns flipping a wink over the cardboard net trying to force their opponent to miss the net or shoot out of bounds.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Jigsaw Monopoly: Lancaster PA
boardgame.description:
Jigsaw Monopoly features a 100 piece puzzle of the game board which adds to the fundraising selling point, but does not actually affect gameplay as a paper copy of the board is included should players not wish to complete a puzzle in order to play the game.

The game plays similarly to a traditional game of monopoly but features art of local businesses and landmarks to the Lancaster PA area. Jigsaw Monopoly does include new rules and features that differ to standard monopoly such as:


The option to play the stock market at the end of a players turn
The option to gamble money and properties against the bank for big payoffs which can change the game at any given turn and allows players with poor luck to turn the tide of a game.


—user summary

boardgame.name: International Waters
boardgame.description:
The team is hired for an extraction: an artist on a corp-sponsored voyage needs to be 'retrieved'. There is a twist: she is stuck on a container ship that is not going anywhere!

A scenario about international transport, labor relations and art -- will the team succeed when they have to operate in International Waters?

The scenario can be used with any cyberpunk tabletop RPG game, but the structure is set up to support The Sprawl, the cyberpunk RPG published by Ardens Ludere. This is an independent work.

boardgame.name: Prinny 1 & 2: Exploded and Reloaded
boardgame.description:
When their demonic master, “Beauty Queen” Etna, tasks her lowly Prinny Squad with fetching anything her heart desires, it is do or die, dood! This double dose of games features updated graphics, intense gameplay, and familiar faces from the DISGAEA series!

Source: The Publisher Website.
boardgame.videogamecompilation: Prinny 2: Dawn of Operation Panties, Dood!
Prinny: Can I Really be the Hero?

boardgame.name: Il Gioco della Gallina
boardgame.description:
Learn the cycle of the seasons, the sustainable lifestyle, the Slow Food association and the Presidia around the world.

Each square includes a test: answer a question, mimic, draw, stand still for a turn or roll the dice. Memory, ingenuity and imagination make your chicken run faster than that of the other players. The first chicken to cross the finish line ... wins!

—user summary

boardgame.name: Il Gioco della Fattoria
boardgame.description:
How does a farm work? How is organic honey produced? Who knows what are the ripening times of the tomato or how the vine is grown? Learning the rhythms and mechanisms of agriculture, the good one, and discovering the healthiest and quality foods by playing.

The players are called to face the tests of the game in four different categories: Vegetable Garden and Orchard, Olive Grove and Vineyard, Organic Agriculture and Farm Animals. Each category corresponds to a test, which will lead players to have to answer questions, mimic or draw, or play memory or misspelled words.

The farm game can be played individually or in teams and the winner will be whoever has obtained at least three points in each of the four categories.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Bogowie wojny: Robert E. Lee
Gods of War: Robert E.Lee
boardgame.description:
Gods of war - Robert E. Lee is a historical wargame, set in time of American Civil War and mid 19th century.
You can play battles from Bull Run to Gettysburg but also from Solferino to Sedan.
The game is part of a series called gods of war. The first was the Gods of War – Napoleon. The game concerned the Napoleonic wars and was published only in Polish.
Another planned title is Gods of War – Togo, which will enable naval battles in the period from the Battle of Trafalgar to the Battle of Tsushima.
Each game in the series has its patron, general or admiral who won many battles. In the case of General Lee, he became the patron of the game due to the fact that the project initially concerned only the American Civil War. The game was very well received, so we created its second edition, which allows you to play through various conflicts in the mid-19th century, from the Crimean War to the Franco-Prussian War.

The main rulebook contains lists for the armies of the Union and the Confederacy.
Successive armies and war theaters are issued with add-ons to the game.
The first was the Rule Britannia which introduced two British armies – the main one and the colonial one. Their organization and armament concern the late 1850s and the first half of the 1860s, so they allow for the hypothetical participation of the British in the American Civil War, but also the 2nd Opium War, the Indian Mutiny, or even the expedition to Abyssinia.

Play the role of the commander-in-chief of an entire army and you will play the battle from this perspective. The game is therefore designed to play the greatest battles of the era, such as Gettysburg, Sedan, or Solferino. Your main task will be to manage your generals. You can have an excellent battleplan, but if you order an offensive to a cautious general or defense, to very aggressive one – your plan may fail. Imagine Jackson instead of Ewell at Gettysburg and you will get the point. Poor commander won’t be able to execute a sophisticated plan, but they may be good enough for a frontal assault or static defense. As a commander in chief you have to bear in mind all of this.

The fog of war is also very important. We use a system of patrol markers, at least half of them are “empty” (just a patrol) half of them hide corps. Your enemy does not now which patrol marker is just a patrol or a corps. Only when two patrol markers or patrol and a unit close to certain distance, they are revealed. And that’s how you again have to thing as a real commander in chief from mid 19th century. Is that hill in the middle a good spot for artillery? So is this enemy patrol marker just an empty marker or maybe his reserve artillery? You have to read terrain, and make a lot of guessing. Make a decisions without a full knowledge of your enemy positions. That’s the real mid 19th century warfare!

The game is scaled to easily play huge battles, so one infantry and cavalry stand is one brigade, one artillery stand is on brigade or battalion of artillery. Because of the focus of commanding many things like combat or movement are simplified. As a commander in chief you don’t bother about tactics of regiments or individual brigades, but you will watch the performance of entire corps, and divisions.

Recommended for 6mm.
Publisher produce own range of miniatures.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Marvel Champions: Das Kartenspiel – The Mad Titan's Shadow
Marvel Champions: El Juego de Cartas – La sombra del Titán Loco
Marvel Champions: Il Gioco di Carte – L'Ombra del Titano Folle
Marvel Champions: Le Jeu De Cartes – L'ombre du Titan Fou
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – The Mad Titan's Shadow
漫威群英传：疯狂泰坦之影扩展
boardgame.description:
The universe is full of both good and evil. Mighty heroes clash with dastardly villains in every galaxy, and yet one threat has risen above all the others. One being has established himself as a scourge on all life, whose power is unrivaled across all the cosmos.

Of course, we are talking about Thanos.

In this third campaign expansion for Marvel Champions: The Card Game, you and your fellow heroes must challenge the forces of Thanos. This massive expansion contains a brand-new campaign featuring five thrilling scenarios pitting you against members of the zealous Black Order, including Ebony Maw, Proxima Midnight, Corvus Glaive, and, of course, the Mad Titan himself. As with previous expansions, you can play each of these scenarios individually or as part of a larger campaign, and with a slew of new modular encounter sets, there will be ample opportunity to mix things up for all of your Marvel Champions content. Of course, a new wave of expansions means more heroes as well, and The Mad Titan’s Shadow starts it off with the mighty champions Adam Warlock and Spectrum, both of whom come with fully pre-built and ready-to-play decks right out of the box.

—description from the publisher
